articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Indian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Indian President
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Monday sent a message of greeting to Pranab Mukherjee, president of the Republic of India, on the occasion of the Day of the Republic of India.
					 The message wished the president good health and happiness and the people of India progress and prosperity, expressing belief that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in various fields.

articles.title: Ri Su Yong Meets Diplomatic Envoys of ASEAN Here
articles.content:
Ri Su Yong Meets Diplomatic Envoys of ASEAN Here
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- Ri Su Yong, foreign minister of the DPRK, met and had a talk with diplomatic envoys of ASEAN countries here on Monday.
					 Present there were Cambodian Ambassador Op Sisawada, Lao Ambassador Kiettisak Keobanhdith, Vietnamese Ambassador Pham Viet Hung, Indonesian Ambassador Bambang Hiendrasto and Councilor of the Malaysian embassy Mohd Nor Azrin Bin Md Zain.
					
					 Ri Su Yong referred to the struggle of the army and people of the DPRK set out to devotedly implement the important tasks advanced by supreme leader Kim Jong Un in his New Year address.
					
					 He informed the diplomatic envoys of the DPRK government's efforts for realizing the tasks for reunifying Korea and foreign policy stand clarified in the New Year address.
					
					 Exchanged at the talk were opinions on a series of matters of mutual concern including the issue of developing the friendly relations between the DPRK and ASEAN countries.

articles.title: DPRK Ambassador to Venezuela Appointed
articles.content:
DPRK Ambassador to Venezuela Appointed
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- Ri Sung Gil was appointed as DPRK ambassador to Venezuela, according to a decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly.

articles.title: DPRK Marathoner Finishes First at Asian Championship
articles.content:
DPRK Marathoner Finishes First at Asian Championship
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- DPRK marathoner Kim Hye Gyong came first at the 15th Asian Marathon Championship and the 2015 Hong Kong Marathon held in Hong Kong, China on Jan. 25.
					 They brought together more than 90 men and women marathoners from 19 countries and regions including the DPRK, Ethiopia, Kenya and Japan.
					
					 She clocked 2:31:46 to come first to the finish line.
					
					 Meanwhile, DPRK marathoner Pak Chol placed second in men's marathon while DPRK marathoner Kim Mi Gyong came second in women's marathon at the 15th Asian Marathon Championship.

articles.title: Copper Wall Hanging, Gift to Kim Il Sung from Egyptians
articles.content:
Copper Wall Hanging, Gift to Kim Il Sung from Egyptians
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- On display at the International Friendship Exhibition House in the DPRK is a copper wall hanging presented by an Egyptian art troupe as a gift to President Kim Il Sung.
					 Invited to attend the April Spring Friendship Art Festival in Pyongyang on the occasion of the 73rd birthday of Kim Il Sung, the artistes of the troupe prepared the gift with the help of a reputed craftsman in Cairo.
					
					 The copper sculpture, redolent of a round fruit bowel, is carved in relief with the Goddess of ancient Egypt, with hieroglyphic characters inscribed on its right and left. It is said that Egyptians worship the Goddess as a prophet of their future.
					
					 The gift represents the deep reverence of the Egyptian artistes and other people for Kim Il Sung, the peerlessly great man.

articles.title: Kwanmun Kindergarten No. 1 in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Kwanmun Kindergarten No. 1 in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- The Kwanmun Kindergarten No. 1 in Rangnang District, Pyongyang, is well known throughout the country for having put its preschool education on an IT basis.
					 A video on it was screened at the 13th National Meeting of Educators held last year.
					
					 What is noteworthy is that all teachers of the kindergarten are capable of making multimedia for education.
					
					 The "Future", program for the intellectual development of preschoolers produced by the kindergarten, won a top prize at the national educational experimental apparatus and teaching aids exhibition.
					
					 The kindergarten is now striving to put its IT-based education system on a higher level.

articles.title: End to US Military Occupation over S. Korea Demanded
articles.content:
End to US Military Occupation over S. Korea Demanded
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- All Koreans should turn out as one in the nationwide struggle to put an end to the U.S. military occupation and domination over south Korea, Rodong Sinmun Monday says in an article. 
					 The article goes on:
					
					 The south Korea-U.S. "mutual defense pact" concluded 65 years ago is an unpardonable country-selling one as it has desperately blocked the independent development of the south Korean society, laid a stumbling block in the way of the Korean nation for peace and reunification of the country and brought a war disaster to Korea. 
					
					 The U.S. is the arch criminal driving the south Korean authorities into military confrontation with fellow countrymen, getting them bound to agreements for a war against the DPRK. 
					
					 The U.S.-south Korea military nexus and cooperation for confrontation with the DPRK are laying stumbling block in the way of achieving peace and independent reunification of the Korean peninsula. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities' blind following of the U.S. brigandish moves for aggression against the DPRK is shame on the nation. The history of the U.S. occupation of south Korea represents a shameful history of traitorous rulers' dependence on outside forces and a criminal one of cooperation with outsiders for invading the DPRK. 
					
					 The south Korean people can neither get rid of misfortune and pain nor can the danger of war be defused on the Korean peninsula nor the north-south relations improve as long as the U.S. keeps south Korea under its military occupation and domination and sycophants and traitors are allowed to kowtow to the aggressors. 
					
					 The nation should no longer allow the south Korean people to suffer calamities and pain due to the U.S. domination and subjugation.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams US Scenario for Biochemical Warfare against Korean Nation
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams US Scenario for Biochemical Warfare against Korean Nation
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- It was newly disclosed that the U.S. stockpiled chemical weapons in Okinawa, Japan for attacking the DPRK.
					 According to declassified diplomatic documents of the Japanese government, the U.S. government asserted that chemical weapons serve as "deterrent" against the DPRK, while informing the Japanese government in 1970 that it was stockpiling chemical weapons in Okinawa for another Korean war.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 This is sheer sophism reminding one of a robber claiming his dagger for looting properties of other's house is for "self-protection".
					
					 The army and the people of the DPRK can never forget the biochemical warfare the U.S. fought against the Korean people in the 1950s. 
					
					 The U.S. imperialists mercilessly killed more than 1.23 million peaceable civilians in the northern half of Korea in the whole period of the Korean war not only through indiscriminate air raids but through barbarous biochemical warfare.
					
					 These hair-raising atrocities of the U.S. imperialists put into the shade even the crimes committed by the Hitler fascists.
					
					 The U.S. imperialist aggressors who committed such thrice-cursed crimes without hesitation are brutes in human skin and the sworn enemy of the Korean people.
					
					 The U.S. stockpiling of chemical weapons in Okinawa brings to light its grisly scenario to wage the same biochemical warfare as what it did during the last Korean war. It remains unchanged in its wild ambition.
					
					 It is quite preposterous for the U.S. imperialists to style themselves "a human rights champion" and "guardian of peace" as they are keen to launch the biochemical warfare. Their behavior is only touching off resentment and anger of the Korean people and other peace-loving people of the world.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Blasts S. Korea for Laying Hurdle in Way of Reunion of Divided Families
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Blasts S. Korea for Laying Hurdle in Way of Reunion of Divided Families
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities are taking a ridiculous attitude towards the issue of reunion of divided families and relatives in the north and the south of Korea.
					 The south Korean chief executive worked hard to mislead public opinion, blustering that the issue should be resolved, away from "politics and ideology," and the north should come out for dialogue with "open heart" and creating impression that the north was to blame for having failed to arrange the above-said reunion.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes in a commentary in this regard: The south Korean authorities are going busy with wordplays intended to twist the nature of the situation, hoodwink public opinion and deliberately create impression favoring them. Such rhetoric will never help them evade their responsibility for having laid artificial obstacles in the way of reunion of divided families and relatives and blocked dialogue and cooperation.
					
					 The said reunion is a very important humanitarian undertaking for the Koreans artificially divided by foreign forces.
					
					 Frankly speaking, it is a practice for warring parties to cease engagement when a humanitarian issue is raised even in a war time.  However, the south Korean regime is making even the humanitarian cooperation a victim of their confrontation policy.
					
					They are talkative about "dialogue" but, on the other hand, they announced that they would stage joint military exercises with the U.S. as scheduled.
					
					 We would like to ask the south Korean authorities if they think a humanitarian undertaking can go with saber-rattling and if the joint military drills to do harm to the fellow countrymen are more important than dialogue, cooperation and humanitarian work.
					
					 If the south Korean regime is truly concerned for the reunion of divided families and relatives, it should make a bold decision to clear such stumbling blocks as the "May 24 steps" and the war drills targeting the north.

articles.title: S. Korean Paper Blasts Regime's Fascist Attempt
articles.content:
S. Korean Paper Blasts Regime's Fascist Attempt
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet paper Minjok Ilbo editorially condemned on Jan. 22 the fascist attempt of the south Korean authorities going all the more reckless as time goes by.
					 In the wake of the disbandment of the Unified Progressive Party on Dec. 19 last year, the security authorities have continued repression of the progressive bodies and personages, the editorial said.
					
					 The regime, which has regarded the Bar Association for Democratic Society as a thorn in its flesh, is scheming to let the security forces disorganize the body, it noted, and went on:
					
					 This is precisely political revenge on the Association.
					
					 The regime would be well advised to discontinue the suppression and step down at an early date, properly understanding that its escalation of the repression will only lead to self-destruction.

articles.title: S. Korean Internet Paper Urges Authorities to Stop War Drills against North
articles.content:
S. Korean Internet Paper Urges Authorities to Stop War Drills against North
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet paper Voice of People on Jan. 22 editorially accused the U.S. and south Korean military bellicose forces of their moves for joint military exercises.
					 There is no sign of mending the bedeviled south-north relations, the editorial deplored.
					
					 Now is the time for the authorities to look into whether their persistent insistence on joint military drills with the U.S. brings any substantial benefit to them, it noted.
					
					 There is no reason for the authorities not to take any step for getting substantial benefit from dialogue with the north, it stressed.

articles.title: South Korean Organizations Protest Supreme Court's Unfair Decision
articles.content:
South Korean Organizations Protest Supreme Court's Unfair Decision
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- The south Korean organizations condemned the unfair decision of the court on the case of the UPP's (Unified Progressive Party) attempted rebellion.
					 The supreme court of south Korea held a trial on the case of the attempted rebellion on Jan. 22 and sentenced Ri Sok Gi, former lawmaker from the UPP, and others concerned to nine years in prison.
					
					 The Solidarity for Progress made public a statement condemning the supreme court for inviting shame by yielding to power.
					
					 The decision would be recorded as an action against democracy and the nation as it infringed upon conscience and freedom of expression and association and made a retreat in the movement for peace and reunification, the statement said, warning that those who made such decision and the present regime would surely face punishment.
					
					 The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty in a statement on Jan. 23 termed the decision unfair as it suppressed the freedom of expression and violated the freedom of political activities.
					
					 The statement voiced opposition to the present regime's moves to revive "yusin" dictatorship and showed the will to fight to the last to win democracy and freedom of political activities in south Korea.

articles.title: S. Korean Organization Presents Petition to UN Human Rights Council
articles.content:
S. Korean Organization Presents Petition to UN Human Rights Council
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- The Bar Association for Democratic Society in south Korea presented a petition to the UN Human Rights Council on Jan. 23, according to MBC of south Korea.
					 In the petition, the association accused the south Korean prosecution of working hard to take disciplinary actions against lawyers affiliated to the association though they are not liable to them when they performed their duties in line with international law and international human rights standards.
					
					 Such moves of the prosecution are unreasonable as they encroach upon the right to pleading and freedom of rally and association, it added.

articles.title: Bird Flu, Foot and Mouth Disease Continue to Occur in S. Korea
articles.content:
Bird Flu, Foot and Mouth Disease Continue to Occur in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- Bird flu broke out on a farm in Phochon, Kyonggi Province on Jan. 23, according to MBC of south Korea.
					 Chickens were all culled and buried and any movement of poultry within 10 km around the farm was prohibited.
					
					 Bird flu also occurred in Kosong County, South Kyongsang Province, leading to culling and burying many ducks.
					
					 An examination of 10 pigs on a farm in Poun County, North Chungchong Province confirmed foot and mouth disease, according to KBS on the same day.

articles.title: Young Korean Officials in Japan Meet
articles.content:
Young Korean Officials in Japan Meet
 Tokyo, January 24 (KNS-KCNA) -- A meeting of young Korean officials took place at the Korean Hall in Tokyo on Jan. 22 to vow to display all their enthusiasm to live up to the loving care and trust shown by Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					 Ho Jong Man, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), said in a speech that the young Korean officials are the happy and proud core members of the younger generation as they are waging the youth movement in the glorious era of Kim Jong Un under his leadership.
					
					 He called upon them to work hard with the determination to certainly usher in a new heyday of Chongryon for the happiness of compatriots and the hopeful morrow of the young Koreans in Japan.
					
					 Other speakers vowed to display their loyalty and enthusiasm in the struggle to usher in a new heyday of the movement of Koreans in Japan, keeping pace with the young people in the homeland.
					
					 A resolution to be presented to Kim Jong Un was read out at the meeting.
					
					 The resolution praised Kim Jong Un as the tender-hearted father and great teacher who is putting forward the Koreans in Japan as the reliable successors to the movement of Koreans in Japan under his loving care.
					
					 The young Koreans in Japan will hold in high esteem peerless great man Marshal Kim Jong Un and exalt the honor of being a model of the movement of overseas young compatriots and carry forward the lineage of the patriotic movement, having the pride and self-esteem of the nation upholding the great leader and benevolent teacher.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Politics Lauded by Foreign Newspapers
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Politics Lauded by Foreign Newspapers
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- Foreign newspapers carried articles praising the personality of Marshal Kim Jong Un as a great man and his noble traits.
					 The Indonesian newspaper International Media on Jan. 7 carried an article lauding the characteristics of his politics.
					
					 It said that firstly, his politics is consistent with philosophical thoughts, citing his first open speech in April, 2012 which drew the world attention.
					
					 Secondly, his politics is firm in determination and transparent in faith, it said, introducing the courage and pluck of Kim Jong Un who made sure that satellite Kwangmyongsong-3-2 was successfully launched without the slightest vacillation though the situation on the Korean peninsula was grim in December, 2012.
					
					 Thirdly, his politics is mysterious one which no one can predict, it noted, adding that he is driving the U.S. into a tight corner with his stratagem the depth and width of which nobody knows in the ceaseless confrontation with the U.S.
					
					 The Nigerian newspaper Nigerian Observer on Jan. 7 edited an article lauding the politics of the peerless great man who is leading socialist Korea to victory.
					
					 The January 1st-15th issue of the Bulgarian newspaper Novo Rabotnichesko Delo in an article titled "Proud edifices built thanks to the Workers' Party of Korea's idea on attaching importance to science and talents" introduced in detail Wisong Scientists Dwelling District, apartment houses for lecturers of Kim Chaek University of Technology and Yonphung Scientists Holiday Camp successfully built under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Meanwhile, an article titled "Songun brilliant commander and socialist Korea" was posted by the Brazilian Committee for Solidarity with the DPRK on its website on Jan. 7.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary to Be Celebrated in Czech Republic
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary to Be Celebrated in Czech Republic
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- A Czech preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) was formed in Prague on January 20.
					 Jaroslav Kafka, chairman of the Paektusan Czech-Korean Friendship Association, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee set the celebration period from Jan. 21 to Feb. 16 and decided to hold a seminar, round-table talks, photo exhibition, film show and other political and cultural events praising the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il during the period.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary to Be Celebrated in Ethiopia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary to Be Celebrated in Ethiopia
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- An Ethiopian preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) was formed in Addis Ababa on January 20.
					 Nigatu Dagnachew, chairman of the Ethiopian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to hold political and cultural events praising the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary to Be Celebrated in Serbia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary to Be Celebrated in Serbia
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- A Serbian preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) was formed in Belgrade on January 19.
					 Batric Mijovic, general secretary of the New Yugoslav Communist Party of Serbia, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee set the celebration period from Jan. 20 to Feb. 16 and decided to give wide publicity to the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il and hold a meeting, seminar, lecture and other political and cultural events during the period.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary to Be Celebrated in Kyrgyzstan
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary to Be Celebrated in Kyrgyzstan
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- A Kyrgyzstan preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) was formed in Bishkek on January 20.
					 A. Usupbayev, chairman of the Central Council of the People Unity-"Kyrgyz El" Republican Political Party who doubles as chief of the Kyrgyz Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to hold colorful political and cultural events praising the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje de felicitacion a presidente indio
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje de felicitacion a presidente indio
Pyongyang, 26 de enero (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 26 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente indio, Pranab Mukherjee con motivo del Dia de la Republica de la India.
					 En su misiva, el remitente expreso su conviccion de que las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre ambos paises se ampliaran y se desarrollaran en varias ramas y deseo al destinatario buena salud y felicidad y  al pueblo indio el progreso y la prosperidad.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun revela plan de guerra bioquimica de EE.UU.
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun revela plan de guerra bioquimica de EE.UU.
Pyongyang, 26 de enero (ACNC) -- Recientemente, fue publicado el hecho de que Estados Unidos depositaba las armas quimicas en Okinawa de Japon con el objetivo de atacar a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					 Segun los descifrados documentos diplomaticos del gobierno japones, el gobierno estadounidense informo al japones que almacenaba las armas quimicas en Okinawa frente a la guerra de agresion a la RPDC, pretextando que dichas armas son "medios disuasivos" contra esta.
					
					 Esto es una sofisteria de bandido que intenta asaltar la casa ajena justificando su arma mortifera como "medio de autodefensa".
					
					  Asi senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual de este lunes y continua:
					
					  El ejercito y el pueblo de Corea no pueden olvidar nunca la barbaridad de guerra bioquimica cometida por EE.UU. contra el pueblo coreano en la decada de 1950.
					
					  Debido al bombardeo indiscriminado y susodicha barbaridad de los imperialistas yanquis, llego a mas de un millon 230 mil el numero de los habitantes inocentes asesinados en la RPDC durante todo el periodo de la pasada guerra coreana.
					
					  Las atrocidades de los imperialistas yanquis son peores que los crimenes cometidos por los fascistas hitlerianos.
					
					 El almacenamiento de armas quimicas en Okinawa deja conocer la siniestra e invariable ambicion de EE.UU. de volver a lanzar la guerra bioquimica en el territorio de la RPDC.
					
					  A pesar de ello, los imperialistas norteamericanos se portan como "defensores de derechos humanos y paz", lo cual causa solo el odio y la indignacion del pueblo coreano y los demas pacifistas del mundo.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun critica actitud dual del Sur de Corea en cuanto al encuentro de familiares separados
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun critica actitud dual del Sur de Corea en cuanto al encuentro de familiares separados
Pyongyang, 26 de enero (ACNC) -- Ahora las autoridades surcoreanas toman la actitud injusta en cuanto al problema de encuentro de familiares y parientes separados en el Norte y el Sur de Corea. La mandataria surcoreana engano la opinion publica hablando como si la RPDC fuera culpable de la no apertura del encuentro de familiares y parientes separados.
					Especificamente, dijo que es necesario "resolver" ese problema apartandolo de la "politica e ideal" y el Norte (de Corea) debe acudir al dialogo con el "alma abierta".
					
					Las autoridades surcoreanas no pueden evitar su responsabilidad por bloquear el dialogo y cooperacion poniendo obstaculos al encuentro de ese tipo con tales palabras que enganan la opinion publica tergiversando la esencia de la situacion.
					
					Asi revela el diario Rodong Sinmun en su comentario individual divulgado el dia 26 y prosigue:
					
					El encuentro de familiares y parientes separados es una labor humanitaria muy importante para la nacion coreana separada artificialmente por las fuerzas extranjeras.
					
					Es una costumbre que aun en el tiempo de guerra, ambas partes cesan el fuego si surge el problema humanitario. Pero las autoridades surcoreanas usan hasta la cooperacion humanitaria en sus objetivos de politica conflictiva.
					
					Ahora ellas hablan del "dialogo" por una parte y por la otra, declaran que desplegaran segun lo planificado los ejercicios militares conjuntos con EE.UU.
					
					Entonces, les preguntamos: ?Son compatibles las labores humanitarias y las maniobras de guerra? ?los simulacros belicos para atacar a la parte connacional son mas importantes que el dialogo, la cooperacion y las labores humanitarias?
					
					Si las autoridades surcoreanas estan interesadas de veras en el encuentro de familiares y parientes, deberan tomar la valiente decision de eliminar primero los obstaculos principales como las "medidas del 24 de mayo" y cancelar los ejercicios de guerra anti-RPDC.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun denuncia intento de Japon de convertirse en potencia militar
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun denuncia intento de Japon de convertirse en potencia militar
Pyongyang, 26 de enero (ACNC) -- El gobierno japones aumento al maximo el presupuesto de defensa nacional de ese ano y refuerza mas las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa". 
					Japon ocupa el segundo lugar en la posesion de fuerzas armadas en el mundo capitalista. E insatisfecho con esto, agranda al maximo el presupuesto de defensa nacional, revela el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual del dia 25 y continua:
					
					De esta manera, el pais isleno trata  de tomar el camino de la potencia militar y la expansion a ultramar. 
					
					Japon recurre mas abiertamente a la conversion en la potencia militar bajo la instigacion de EE.UU. a contrapelo de las cada dia mas elevadas voces de precaucion de los paises vecinos y de la sociedad internacional. 
					
					Cometer la agresion a ultramar bajo el amparo de potencia es el metodo rutinario de los reaccionarios japoneses. 
					
					A fin de utilizar Japon como brigada de choque en el cumplimiento de la estrategia sobre Asia-Pacifico, EE.UU. se vale de todos los metodos y medios. 
					
					EE.UU. instiga a Japon a ejercer el "derecho a la autodefensa colectiva" y renunciar los "tres principios de exportacion de armas".
					
					Los reaccionarios japoneses persiguen tomar junto con EE.UU. la hegemonia militar en la region de Asia-Pacifico, debido a lo cual se cierne el nubarron de guerra en el Nordeste Asiatico. 
					
					Japon se dirige a la militarizacion sin sacar la debida leccion de su derrota amarga sufrida en la segunda guerra mundial, lo cual traera el  arruinamiento de si mismo.
